reviews.sentence: Burn Out. Upon arrival around 830 pm there were 2 KCFD engines. We proceeded to check in and were assured everything was going to be ok and we could go to our room as soon as the KCFD cleared the hotel. The roads were very icy this past Friday night and very cold so we were hoping all would be ok. After about 10 minutes we got the ok to proceed to our room on the ground level. fire was on 3rd level. All was ok when we got to our room so we started unloading our bags for the weekend. 20 minutes later my daughter goes into the restroom an nearly kills herself in a wipeout on the wet bathroom floor. Inspecting further. Water was coming down thru our ceiling in bathroom and in room on one of the double beds. Of coarse guest services was immediately called and they lady said Oh We Will Have To Move You. Another 15 minutes go by water getting worse the wife goes back up to check in desk to see if they are going to get us moved. The lady at check in desk was on the phone to manger of hotel and at that time she told her You are going to be the first to know so you are going to beat the rush at other hotels but we are going to evacuate the entire building in about 10 minutes. So we packed back up and left with no charge. I would really like to experience this hotel being a season ticket member at Arrowhead. CHIEFS. But we did not get to this particular weekend. What we did get to experience in hotel the lobby was clean room was clean beds were comfortable to sit on for about 30 minutes. Other than that could not tell you.
Great for the price. Decent hotel for the price and conveniently located off the highway.

nice hotel nice price. we were staying for Big 12 Tourney and booked a room that was at a good price and staff was very helpful to get us info on how to get a ride there. staff was nice and had food and bar. Also the pillows were big and soft KC Royals stadium carpeting had lost its nap and was wavy.

LocationCharged 1500 for smoking in the room and no one in the party smoked. Hotel claimed new guest smelled smoke charged my cc without notifying me then said to bad. new guest word is gold you the checked out guest pays. Time to call my lawyer.

I can not believe this hotel is rated so high. The entry is older and the carpets are dirty. The room we had smelled. I Was going to deal with it until we realized that the sliding door to the balcony was open an inch and could not be shut because it was jammed and broken. We left that night at 12 and got another hotel. Seriously horrible experience.

Good if you are going to a ballgame otherwise find another hotel. This hotel is dated and has some interesting clientele. Upon check in there was a drunken card party directly across from the front desk and the ladies playing cards were so loud that I could not hear the front desk person. The hotel needs some TLC. The layout of the parking is not great. Noise from the bathroom in the next room indicated that there is zero insulation in the wall. Ie I could tell that it was a man urinating in the next room rather than a woman. On the positive side the bed and shower were good as is the case in all Sheraton hotels that I have visited. Price is good but you get what you pay for.
Friendly staff. Friendly helpful staff. Room was clean but smelled of stale smoke. Great deal for the price.
Location awesome little pricey for what you get Location. Directly across from Arrowhead stadium. Beds were comfortable. Hotel is obviously older but they have redone rooms. Could have been cleaner.
Great place friendly staff priced right. Friendly great location for Royals games. Priced very reasonable. Would have liked to at least have a Continental Breakfast.

Nice clean room for the price. The outside of the hotel may appear aged but it is actually very nice inside. My main concern when staying in a hotel is that the rooms are clean and this one was. The staff was very friendly and my room was very clean. I would stay here again when I come to Kansas City.
Stained Carpet. Carpet had stains every where. Definitely not worth the money I paid.

Friendly staff not the greatest room. The staff was wonderful. However the rooms were very humid and the facilities were not the greatest could definitely use an upgrade. The restaurant is very good but it took forever for anyone to greet us and take our order. Overall I would say it is a good Hotel close to the ball field but the price was much too high for the room. Great food. Great location close to Kaufman stadium and Chiefs stadium. Updating.

it is not so much the Hotel as check. in was a breeze staff was cordial room was alright but was way too expensive. My main contention is the restaurant sports bar located inside the Sheraton. The place seems disorganized at best or very short handed or lacking in how to run an eating establishment. Yes it was Christmas Day and yes there was a Broncos Chiefs game being played later in the day but still the wait on service was incredibly long service required hunting down the server to determine what happened to the food order we placed and then again hunting them down to get the check so we could pay up. The food fare was alright but service was quite lacking and it is a place we will not return to.

Worst Hotel Ever. Nothing. First I get there and had to wait for my room to get ready along with 7 or 8 other people. Then the next day housekeeping came took out the trash and left towels but just threw the covers back on the bed. Saturday they did not come clean at all and then the keys would not work. To top it off the breakfast is too expensive especially when all we ate was a waffle that was split between the two of us 2 sausage links and some cereal. That was 26 but I checked my card and there is a 42 charge from them on it. I can go to IHOP and get two full meals for less than that. If check in is a 3 no one should be waiting around forever to check in. Everyday there were people waiting to check in because they did not have rooms ready even though people were checking out way before check out time of 12. Not once did they offer us a complimentary anything. That was the first and last time we will be staying at that overpriced hotel. At least I know if I go somewhere else more expensive I will get free breakfast and Happy Hour. I will also get a room that looked like the picture. Oh and then upper management really has problems. When a customer had a complaint there response to the person on duty was just deal with it. That is so unprofessional expecialy when a worker is getting yelled and screamed at. Another thing they offered other people a complimentary free breakfast. When you inconvenience someone you could have at least offered them a free stay. Well hell at least they got offered something at all unlike us.

Great hotel for the price. The hotel was really nice and the bed was very comfy. Staff was friendly and courteous and we enjoyed our stay despite only staying one night. I did not like that breakfast was not included with our room. All other hotels I have stayed in have provided at the very least a cold breakfast for free. Many of them now give a hot breakfast for free to their guests. I would have very much liked to have had a free hot breakfast rather than having to pay for it.

Expected much more. Breakfast buffet was good but expensive for what was offered. Bed very comfortable. that is about itfod from restaurant not bad service good. Big stains on floor refrigerator microwave not available in all rooms needs updated badly just seemed rundown expected more for the price we paid. Parking is horrible. Continental breakfast would be nice. Tv in rooms sucked as far as channels available and remote. no channel guide at all in room. No menu in room at all. To top it all off no electricity saturday night would think would have back up generator or something. But this meant no elevator no hot water no lights and no ac miserable last night. Would like a discount on last night. And when checking in you are witness to other unhappy customers not a good sign. We really just wanted to leave.

Did the job but a little pricey for what it had. It was walking distance to Kaufman Stadium. Even though not much around the location it was only a couple of miles to restaurants and entertainment. Wish they had breakfast in the morning you did not have to pay for. Although a decent stay could use a few upgrades and repairs especially for what it cost to stay.

Did the job but a little pricey for what it had. It was walking distance to Kaufman Stadium. Even though not much around the location it was only a couple of miles to restaurants and entertainment. Wish they had breakfast in the morning you did not have to pay for. Although a decent stay could use a few upgrades and repairs especially for what it cost to stay.
Hotel run down things clean and function ok but not worth the price.

Close to Kansas City football baseball stadiums. Decent hotel. A little need for updating but bed was good and room clean. Very small bathroom. Toilet backed up and tub did not drain well BUT staff took care of it immediately very professional. Front desk was very nice pleasant. Hotel sports bar was ok as well food was good. No breakfast included in room rate not much of a continental one during the week would recommend a buffet breakfast in the restaurant. Overall nice place to stay if you just need a place to sleep. Decent place to sleep across street from major football baseball stadiums. Across street from major league football baseball stadiums. Breakfast buffet included with room rate.

OK Hotel. I was there at 3 pm to check inlike the website says and I was told that all of the rooms with the double beds were not clean and that I would have to wait. I stayed there until they had a room ready for me and that was at 403pm. If I would have left the lobby I do not know when I would of been able to check in. The lobby was full of people wanting to check in. Luckily the breakfast was included in the room price. The hotel charges 150 for the so called breakfast buffet and it was not good. The gravy for the biscuits and gravy was very watery. There was no cereal or milk for the kids. Location was close to what I was in town for. Expand the so called breakfast buffet. Get a tv channel list in the rooms.
High dollar breakfast but very clean.

Outside Plain and Boxy Inside Nice Lobby Boring Hallways Dirty Rooms Food Not Included. But enjoy our 12 breakfast buffet Service Nonexistent Price. You pay for WAY MORE than you get. do not stay here. This hotel has problems and you way overpay. The rooms are not properly cleaned. The front desk help does not even attempt to make an effort to care about your issues. When you complain you are screaming into the void. Management does not answer their emails. Found a dirty balled up towel in our room. Shower did not work properly. Front desk does not care when you have problems. Management does not answer their emails. Avoid.

Great place. I must say it really was the perfect place to stay. It was quiet and very comfortable beds. They even helped when I forgot something. Even though I got a excellent rate from hotelscom. Long hallway but only negative is they do not supply breakfast in your rate. But they do have breakfast at your expense.
Over priced bed was comphy. No fridge. Swimming pool broken. needed noise control. Staff unfriendly. Over priced. will not stay there again.

I booked this hotel 6 months in advance for a baseball game two weeks prior to arrival I received very generic emailing stating my reservation was canceled due to overboking and was unable to contact anyone to help me at this location. Later in the day I did receive a 2nd email stating they had re booked me at another Mariot and my room would be covered once again a generic email and could not contact anyone except for the Mariot they re booked me at. Once again a week later I received another generic email stating they could honor my stay at no charge due to a cancellation. With that being said customer service is not up to par at this location. The gentlemen that check me in was super nice but was not paying attention to checking me in since he had his kid with him. Upon leaving I check out and wanted a receipt to make sure I would not be charged do to all the problems the lady was super rude about me having a 0 balance due and asked why I needed a receipt. Other then that the reviews on here are horrible for reasons I did not see yes the hotel is outdated but it is very clean beds are comfortable. not sure why we could not get out our balcony maybe a first floor issue. but in the end for the price and convenience of being next to Kaufman stadium I would stay here again. and FYI crossing the road is not horrible we walked across with ease about 45 minutes prior to game time.
Royals Sox game. Decent room for the price great location for a Royals game friendly staff.

Great room price and location to Kaufman and Arrowhead friendly staff clean rooms. The location to Kaufman and Arrowhead stadiums is perfect very short walk. The breakfast was good and had good selection. A bit noisy with the renovations going on but not bad overall.

The clerk at check in had a bad attitude. They do not have ice machines. You have to go into the bar to get ice. Unfortunately nobody was working in there. The room was barely big enough for the beds. TV sound and reception were terrible. While we were staying there the Stanley Cup final game was on. Except not on our TV. When I went to the front desk to ask about it there was already a line of people complaining. The clerk with the attitude said What do you want me to do about it. The place is being renovated and they put us in a room in the bottom floor with the construction dumpster and tool storage bins right outside our window. In the middle of the night the truck came to exchange the dumpster. Every morning the workers would have to get into the tool storage and slam the metal doors. It was rediculous that they put us in a room with all that going on outside our window. We never got any rest. I would never stay here again for any price much less how much we paid. Way over priced for such a dump.
Location great for sporting events but a little dated needs to b upgraded cleaned for the price. Pool was broken. Breakfast was very good.

Ok. So I have stayed here on at least five occasions. This time was much like the previous times. It always seems like there is not enough employees to do the work. Desk clerk was great but room was not ready at 4 pm. Room looked like it was half done. new stuff old stuff. Tried to take a nap but was interrupted by saws. Went to eat before game no food only drinks. loud hallways at 1am. You stay here because it is close to stadium but the price and the quality if not there anymore. I will take my chances and drive a little next time.

My husband and I scheduled a getaway to watch a Chiefs game and had good and bad experiences at this Best Western. The first room we were put in smelled like mildew and the desk clerk Regie put us in a different room upstairs that was much better. The hotel was going through construction which had some inconveniences but the staff Regie girls in restaurant housekepimg were amazing. My biggest complaint and warning is we booked and paid for our room via Expedia. Best Western charged my credit card also. When I talked with the manager he stated it would be refunded the next day. it is been almost 2 months and the hotel has been avoiding my and Expedias attempts to get me reimbursed. Expedia reimbursed their charge to make it right. Please be careful that you do nt get double charged especially since they do not return the money.

Pleasant. Staff was friendly rooms were clean. Continental Breakfast was not ready waiting on cook that was running late offered cold cereal. Toilet ran and made a loud noise all the time. The view of the stadiums over rated not worth 2800 a night.

Expensive but I expected that for being game day. What I did not expect is one server in the bar for as many people were there a dinner menu with a total of 6 items on it no room service even though the book in the room states they have room service with a full menu. I stayed at this hotel twice before when it was a 4 points by Sheridan but this is my last time. Find something different for your gameday. The convenience of being so close to the stadium is not worth the price.
